Text: O God, the nations have invaded Your inheritance; they have defiled Your holy temple; they have reduced Jerusalem to rubble.
Context: The psalmist is describing the desecration of the temple and Jerusalem by foreign invaders, expressing a sense of violation and loss.

Text: They have given the dead bodies of Your servants as food to the birds of the sky, the flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
Context: The verse portrays the aftermath of a battle or siege where the fallen are not afforded proper burials, signifying disrespect and sadness.

Text: They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one to bury them.
Context: The imagery of blood shed and unburied bodies heightens the sense of desolation and horror at the atrocities committed.

Text: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to those around us.
Context: This verse reflects the humiliation and mocking the people of Israel feel from those around them due to their defeat and the desecration of their land.

Text: How long, O LORD? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
Context: The psalmist is questioning God's enduring anger and the consequences of His jealousy, suggesting a feeling of helplessness amidst ongoing suffering.

Text: Pour out Your wrath on the nations that do not know You, and on the kingdoms that do not call on Your name.
Context: The speaker appeals for divine retribution against the pagan nations who do not worship the God of Israel.

Text: For they have devoured Jacob and laid waste his homeland.
Context: The verse accuses the foreign invaders of destroying the nation of Israel, spoken with a tone of condemnation.

Text: Do not hold past sins against us; let Your compassion come quickly, for we are brought very low.
Context: A plea for forgiveness and urgent help, recognizing the people’s vulnerability and dire circumstances.

Text: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name; deliver us and atone for our sins, for Your name’s sake.
Context: This verse is a prayer for deliverance and atonement, highlighting the need for God’s intervention for the sake of His own reputation.

Text: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes, make known among the nations that You avenge the blood of Your servants.
Context: The psalmist expresses concern over the perception of God’s absence, asking for a visible display of divine vengeance to vindicate His people.

Text: Let the groans of the prisoners come before You; according to the greatness of Your power, preserve those condemned to die.
Context: Reflecting on the plight of captives, the psalmist implores God to save those who are suffering and facing death.

Text: Return to our neighbors sevenfold into their laps the reproach they have hurled at You, O Lord.
Context: The verse requests just recompense for the insults directed at God by their enemies, implying a desire for divine justice.

Text: Then we, Your people, the sheep of Your pasture, will praise You forever; from generation to generation, we will proclaim Your praise.
Context: The final verse turns to a note of hope and determination, with the faithful pledging ongoing worship and praise of God across generations.
